author: bridge-bot
content:
<sigpaul> After @ethzed pointed it out to me, I've added a constraint to our BN HTTP API that we won't serve any requests for duties or publish any consensus messages after the merge-fork-epoch if we don't have a synced and reachable execution engine.
I think all CL clients might want to consider doing something like this, if they aren't already. If we don't have this for our testnets, if an EL/CL pair goes out-of-sync then those CL nodes are most likely going to start producing attestations for old heads. This generally means lots of skip slots, heavy resource usage and general network chaos.

On the one hand, the genesis block should have an all-zeros execution payload since we define the genesis block as:
genesis_block = BeaconBlock(state_root=hash_tree_root(genesis_state))
On the other hand, the BeaconState has the latest_execution_payload_header set to some initial values.
Since LH is loading the genesis block from the DB to obtain the latest block hash, it's returning all-zeros. However, if it loaded the BeaconState and read the latest header it'd get a different value.
I'm really starting to feel that the merge initialize_beacon_state_from_eth1 is a waste of time and we should just do the fork transition. There's less edge-cases and we get to test the fork more.)
